boardgame.name: EZD6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rules-light D6 RPG system that puts creativity over complexity, but delivers a suprising amount of variation and mechanical wiggle.

...


EZD6 Core rules: D6 dice pooling with a few key innovations like boons and banes, strikes instead of hit points and variable damage, and a fun player micro-resource called karma.



9 Hero Paths: Scotty cooks the classics with his own spices. Each hero path is nicely separate from the next, with key roles to give you that MVP feeling in your group.



20 classic monsters, 20 crazy ones: This is my favorite section of the book. Placing emphasis on a monster's narrative specialities, rather than numeric, seems too open-ended, but these horrors just nail it. The entries are tight enough to play cold, but weird enough to mod and enjoy from memory.



Tables: No RPG is complete without random ways to select baddies, treasures, NPC names, lair details, story twists, and more. We got those covered.

boardgame.name: Walt Disney's Cinderella Game
boardgame.description:
This is a simple racing game for children based on Walt Disney's 1950 animated film "Cinderella." The multicolor gameboard includes a folding card backdrop with the game's title and movie characters, which creates an effect similar to a stage.

Each player choose a pair of colored metal slipper tokens. Then, one of each pair is dropped into a bag and placed at the race's end (the castle). Progress is determined by drawing character cards that tell how many spaces to move, with each player moving using their remaining slipper. The player who gets to the castle first chooses a slipper randomly from the bag and if it matches theirs, they win the game and become Cinderella. If not, they go back and start the race again from the middle of the game track.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tapeworm Disco Puzzle
boardgame.description:
Tapeworm puzzle disco is a grid based puzzle game where you play as a tapeworm; the local night club owner. It's your job to make sure the fleas enjoy themselves. You'll be helping them collect blood, play bangin tunes and get them to gigs on time.

Each level has an objectives and obstacles like: -Avoid enemies -Don't kill the fleas -Collect all the notes -Help the fleas collect the blood -Open Doors witch switches -Help Fleada get to the gig on time (Fleada is a cat walk model)

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: F O U N D E R S
FOUNDERS
boardgame.description:
In the midst of a windswept, snowy landscape, a group of explorers discover a gigantic cave with a massive structure that radiates out from it. Around this Hearth, the Master Founders lay the foundation for what will become The City, home to the powerful Guilds of I C E!
Following the directives of the first Founders' Council on the Design of the City, as well as the Requests of the first Guilds, you will design and create this famous City from scratch!

F O U N D E R S is a strategic and innovative game of tile placement where each player is in a hidden alliance with 2 other players they don't know.
The games last around 30 min for 3 to 6 players from 12 years old.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Grimm World
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, a nobody went out into the wide fairy tale world to escape from his dreary everyday life and become somebody. Be that nobody and become a somebody.

Grimm World is a open-world card game set in the fairy tale world of the Brothers Grimm and the successor of Grim(m) World: First Steps. Here you play an ordinary person who sets out to experience adventure. The player is not told how his journey should look like. He is free to decide where he goes and what he wants to do. Maybe he wants to accumulate trade and wealth? Or does he want to make a name for himself as a bounty hunter? The world reacts and changes based on your decisions. Are you ready for this adventure?

Grimm World is based on the OWCS (Open World Card System). The OWCS is a system to simulate an Open World as a card game. An Encounter deck with multi-use cards serves as a random encounter, as an equipment deck, it triggers quests, dice rolls are simulated, it defines prices for trading and it simulates the time in the game world. An additional Storybook deck simulates the living world in this game. Depending on the time in the game, new missions appear or disappear, events happen or the world changes. Additionally, your own character can be leveled up and becomes stronger and stronger as the game progresses. Combats in this game are fought on a grid field laid out with cards. Your hand cards serve as life points and determine the character's possible actions during combat. The enemies are controlled by a simple card-based AI.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Shadows at Sundown
boardgame.description:
A sprawling cathedral on one side, with the other showing the catacombs below, for the Pathfinder Second Edition adventure Shadows at Sundown or any home-brewed game.

Unfolded the maps are 24" x 30", and dry erase, wet erase, and even permanent marker being erasable.

boardgame.name: Acción Mutante: El Juego de Rol
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

¡Acción, venganza, violencia, progreso!

El mundo en 2025 es un lugar de mierda y el Espacio no está mucho mejor. Los magnates y sus corporaciones han llevado al límite sus ansias capitalistas, fomentando guerras por los recursos y experimentación química, bacteriológica y genética in extremis, entre otras salvajadas. Cuando los chinos inventaron los condensadores de refractancia e hicieron posible la colonización espacial, todos creímos que eso le daría un respiro a la humanidad. Ilusos. El Espacio se ha convertido en la nueva factoría y zona de recreo de los pijos.

Los mutantes nacemos entre la escoria que quedó aquí abajo y vivimos oprimidos y repudiados. Pero estamos unidos en nuestra desdicha. Cuando la vida te escupe a la cara, cuando hasta tu madre te mea encima, ya no queda nada que perder. Solo puedes mirar hacia arriba. Y asquearte. Y odiar. Y romper, quemar y reiniciar el puto programa de la civilización.

¡Todo el mundo es tonto o moderno!

Acción Mutante es un juego de rol catártico y anormal basado en la película de culto de Álex de la Iglesia. Este artefacto incendiario en forma de manual incluye todo lo necesario para crear tus propias historias sobre mutantes vengadores, opresores tarados y otras mandangas nasty-scifi:


Una descripción del mundo ranciapocalíptico de Acción Mutante una década después de los sucesos de la película. ¡Incluye movidas en el Espacio!
Un sistema de creación de personajes donde los pejotas y penejotas se definen con ineptitudes y disfunciones, ideales para meterles en problemas.
Un sistema de juego perpetrado con alevosía para potenciar el espíritu cafre y brutal del film.
Ráfagas de consejos para convertir cada sesión de juego en una experiencia descojonante.
Tres aventuras completamente desarrolladas y semillas para muchas nuevas historias.
boardgame.rpg: Acción Mutante: El Juego de Rol
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Acción Mutante: El Juego de Rol

boardgame.name: The Emperor's New Clothes
Kejserens nye klæder
boardgame.description:
The Emperor's New Clothes is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Players draw patterns to puzzle together a pretty shirt abiding by the rules set by the Emperor. Each round 3 patterns will be revealed, and one of the players may reserve a pattern. All players then draw their chosen pattern adjacent to something they have already drawn. Some patterns needs to be grouped together orthogonally, others diagonally and some of them not together at all. You score points after 6 rounds and again after 12 rounds - so players are forced to think short term and long term, and most points wins. There is also a bonus for completed rows and diversity.

The game has several difficulty levels and spans from family game to thinky gamer filler.

About the fairy tale:
The Emperor's New Clothes portrays a vain emperor that only wants the finest clothes. Two guys swindle him into believing they can weave an exceptionally beautiful attire that only the smartest can see. In reality there are no clothes but reluctant to admit he isn't smart, he parades through town until a boy yells out: "but he isn't wearing any clothes!"

boardgame.name: Den lille havfrue
The Little Mermaid
boardgame.description:
The Little Mermaid is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Flip cards and cross out 1-3 adjacent animals in the underwater world but watch out because incomplete polyominos will score you negative points at the end. Complete rows and you will get a bonus power.

About the fairy tale:
The Little Mermaid lives together with her five sisters. The youngest and most curious amongst her siblings, she explores the underwater world. Yet life beneath the sea isn't enough for her. When she falls in love with a shipwrecked prince, she makes a deal with the evil witch. She trades her voice for legs, in an attempt to win the prince's everlasting love.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Little Mermaid

boardgame.name: Den grimme ælling
The Ugly Duckling
boardgame.description:
The Ugly Duckling is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Draw polyomino shapes around the animals on the farm and in the country side. You want to fill the board but also to draw around specific animals - each round a new animal will score you extra points.

About the fairy tale:
The Ugly Duckling hatches at a duck family that wants nothing to do with him, because he is different. Chased out into the world, he thus begins a long journey that lasts all winter, throughout which he tries to find out where he belongs. The duckling experiences lots of grievances before finally seeing his own reflection and discovering he is a beautiful swan.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mahō Shōjo
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

¡Campeona, Consejera y Guardiana!
¡Guerrera, Idol y Sanadora!
¡Hijas de la Luz!

Con Mahō Shōjo, tú y tu grupo podréis contar historias sobre chicas que albergan un gran poder en su interior capaz de cambiar el mundo que les rodea. Este juego de rol os permitirá vivir vuestras propias historias del género magical girl, igual que en las series de manga y anime.

Todo es mejor cuando eres tú la protagonista de la historia, luchas contra la adversidad, vives tu propio romance o disfrutas de las pequeñas maravillas de una vida cotidiana… ¡Todo eso mientras tratas de entender tus nuevos poderes!

Mahō Shōjo te ofrece:


Pautas para crear a tu magical girl a partir de los grandes arquetipos del género, e infinidad de variables para personalizarla y convertirla en un personaje único.
Sistemas para explorar Lazos de amistad y romance entre los personajes e involucrarlos en la partida de manera emocionante.
Un sistema de juego basado en movimientos narrativos específicos del género para que las sesiones sean siempre vibrantes y tengan un sabor único.
Consejos y pautas para generar a los servidores de la oscuridad que pondrán a prueba la luz que hay en vuestras magical girls.
Tres enfoques distintos para tus historias que reflejan las principales variables del género y su evolución.
Innumerables y útiles consejos para preparar las sesiones con el mínimo esfuerzo y espectaculares resultados.


¿Serás una campeona de la justicia o una marioneta de la oscuridad?

Juega a Mahō Shōjo para descubrirlo.

boardgame.name: A Deadly Tide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The armies in the north gather, a great tide of warriors is preparing to sweep down on the Plains of Acrothos and sweep all before them who do not bend the knee. Word has spread that the high priestess of Amphoe Wan seeks to gather her people to make war against the invaders, but the followers of Amphoe Wan are scattered, beleaguered, and many seek only to escape further to the south and west.

In truth, few have faith and fewer still are willing to follow the high priestess.


She needs greater power and influence, things that only the Ebon Staff can provide. Can the Ebon Staff save her and her people from slaughter?

Only time will tell and there is precious little of that available

The Deadly Tide, designed for a high-level party of 4-6 characters, is an overland and dungeon adventure that began with M1 A Stranger Amongst Us, continued with M2 The Ebon Staff, and M3 A Gathering Storm. It concludes with A Deadly Tide. This adventure takes the characters to the furthermost reaches of the Plains of Acrothos and into the path of a horde of mounted warriors intent on killing everyone on their path of conquest.

boardgame.name: Snedronningen
The Snow Queen
boardgame.description:
The Snow Queen is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Push your luck to win the best friendship cards but be careful not to reach 10 in a colour that will cause you to bust. The question is simple: Take a card or stop? The set of friendship cards on offer changes every round so the challenge is knowing when to take the card and when to stop.

About the fairy tale:
The Snow Queen has frozen Kay's heart. His best friend Gerda embarks on a long journey to save their friendship while there is still time. She travels across mountains, snow covered forests and frozen lakes towards the cold north, before finally lifting the Snow Queen's curse and proving that friendship conquers all.

boardgame.name: The Princess and the Pea
Prinsessen på ærten
boardgame.description:
The Princess and the Pea is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Be the first to play all your cards on the ever growing pile of mattresses and pillows. Either play 1 card that is higher and changes colour or 1 or more cards that are lower and matches colour. First to empty their hand of cards is the winner.

About the fairy tale:
On a dark night it knocks on the door, and out in the rain a princess seeks shelter. Yet is she a true princess? The queen tests her and does so by providing a bed with a huge tower of mattresses, and a tiny pea placed at the bottom. In the morning the princess wakes from a terrible night's sleep, proving she is a true princess.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Amaranthine Asp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original adventure for 3rd- to 4th-level characters

A vengeful warlock bound his spirit into a terrible amaranthine-hued serpent and seeks to destroy the Red Hawk clan.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #19 - Jun 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magical items like the invincible cuirass, rod of nettles, sea strider boots, and ring of delayed doom!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like castigate, sleepwalk, predator's rhythm, and wandering star motes!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the arcane dabbler, oath of zeal, and arena fighter!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the sinister attic whisperer, the glorious bralani, and the doomed llorona!

boardgame.name: Fyrtøjet
The Tinderbox
boardgame.description:
The Tinderbox is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Play cards simultaneously and reveal them to see what treasures you got this round. You want the most valuable but too much of a good thing might leave you with a bitter taste and zero points.

About the fairy tale:
Heading home the soldier meets a witch that offers him gold and silver coins, if he climbs into a hollow tree and gets a Tinderbox for her. The soldier is greedy and also claims the Tinderbox. Later he discovers its power to call upon the dogs with huge eyes. With his new found power the soldier attempts to win the princess and the entire kingdom.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dock Dilemmas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the city of Cacophony where just about anything can and will happen. In this offering, the party has a little fun on the docks. The 'job board' at the Adventurer's Guild has several options for the party to deal with and they get to choose!

Cacophony is one of our home campaigns and it never fails to provide some fun. This scenario was written for three, third level PCs and set for a two hour time limit.

boardgame.name: House of Wonderments
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After spotting the wanted criminal Jolly Roger, a short foot chase lands you in a local pawnshop after hours. Can your party get the crook caught before the shop has its own revenge?

Cacophony is one of our home campaigns and it never fails to provide some fun. This scenario was written for three, third level PCs and set for a two hour time limit.

boardgame.name: Ships of the Human Sphere
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SEE THINGS YOU WOULDN’T BELIEVE:
COLOSSAL CIRCULARS PLUNGING INTO HUNGRY WORMHOLES, MORAT WARSHIPS ON FIRE NEAR THE ACHERON GATE AND MORE, SO MUCH MORE!

The Second Race for the Stars is far behind us. Now it is time to reap the rewards and reach for Infinity and conquer the galaxy! Never has humanity had such a variety of vessels to explore, colonise, trade, and enjoy the void between the stars as today.

The constant expansion of the Human Sphere is firmly based on its exploring, travelling, and controlling capabilities made real thanks to the vast variety of spaceships, from planetary shuttles to Intra-system probes and the all-might behemoths–the Circulars.

Travelling the Sphere’s systems in a huge plethora of vehicles, from the purely utilitarian to the uber-luxurious, is now a simple matter of having the credit or the backup of your empresa. No world is off-limits for the curious and ambitious.

A planet’s fate may be decided by its surface battles, but the power that controls its space wins the war. Every faction in the Human Sphere has imprinted its personality and military approach to their fleets–in design, equipment, and tactics–requiring carefully planned strategies and competent admirals to carry the day.

Thus, veteran Yujingyu fleets face the vast PanOceanian firepower, the sneaky Haqqislamite armadas, the insidious and chaotic Nomad privateers, the sleek ALEPH sentient ships, the Teseum-clad gunships from Kosmoflot, the persuasive Starmada spacecraft, and the brutal and duplicitous Combined Army, amongst other pirates, alien and non-aligned flotillas.

Be it scientific mission, humanitarian endeavour, commercial operations or military blockades, this book has everything your campaign will need to ensure the mighty void of the Human Sphere us yours for the taking! Remember, space is out there trying to kill you, so why not make sure your enemies go first?

The Ships of the Human Sphere Sourcebook includes:

A complete catalogue of all spacefaring vessels in the Human Sphere–human or otherwise–from humble dingy and tugboat to planet-killer dreadnoughts and space stations!
The rollcall for the most powerful warships in the universe, including the majestic flagships of the G5 Nations and the Combined Armada’s darkest secrets.
A comprehensive guide of gear, upgrades, and customisation options for your spaceships and your faithful crew!
Rules on how to engage your enemy amid the void, making sure you blow them to bits, be it on a one-to-one campaign or a full-fledged stellar fleet battle!

boardgame.name: Technology of the Human Sphere
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ENTER THE WORLD OF TOMORROW AND ITS MAGICAL TECHNOLOGIES!
The Human Sphere, the imminent future of humanity, shines forth with all the magnificence of the technology at the service of the greater good!

Enter a world where pervasive domotics and augmented reality have long since ceased to be a luxury. Discover what it takes to be on top of what is hot and what is cool in fashion, leisure, transportation, and lifestyle amenities in a world where consumerism is the ultimate lifestyle choice.

Make yourself comfortable and let your faithful geist set you up with some nice background music while you consider the advantages of trading in your body for a new, more advanced model or simply upgrade with one of the myriad colourful augmentations. Biotechnology and chemicals enhancement are but a purchase away.

And for our digital customers, delve into Maya and surf the datasphere, confident that your security measures will protect you from minor embarrassments just as our most avant-garde neomaterials and military infrastructure protect you from the vastness of space itself.

Endless seas of products and luxuries await your pleasure. Enjoy the quantronic rush of buying full retail and treat yourself to something nice for a change! From the most backward tools to fully equipped space stations, everything your heart desires can be yours with the simplest credit background check and a series of easy-to-meet payments.

You need a machete? Why not a nanofilament blade? Don’t like your nose? Transform your whole body into your beautiful furzona! Need a ride? Forget about tickets on the next Circular–get your own Class 5 battleship!

Be like GoGo Marlene and live BIG!

So, head right away to your Nomad mercado, your Merovingian Commercial Agent, the Haqqislamite caravanserai of your preference, or even the Warmarket at Warcon! If you find it cheaper, buy it!

The Technology of the Human Sphere sourcebook includes:

A comprehensive analysis of the technologies crucial for the wellbeing of the Human Sphere, including neomaterials and Silk!
How to live like the rich and famous in different corners of the galaxy. An overview on how to acquire, use, and enjoy the material blessings of the Human Sphere.
Dataspheres, augmented realities, infowar, and more! Ideas and rules on living (and surviving!) in a quantronic battlefield.
Security gear, physical augmentations, weapons, labour equipment, and how to mod virtually anything!
The most inclusive list of equipment, gear, weapons, and vehicles of the Human Sphere with over 100 pages of tables including almost everything available in the galaxy!

boardgame.name: The Keyhole of Eternity
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“ONCE YOU HAVE ELIMINATED THE IMPOSSIBLE, WHATEVER REMAINS, HOWEVER IMPROBABLE, MUST BE THE TRUTH.”
– COMMANDER SPOCK

The Keyhole of Eternity is a three-part campaign, previously only available as part of the Star Trek Adventures Tricorder Collector’s Box Set.

The players’ shore leave at the independent colony of Hefner Bay is cancelled when a damaged Klingon warship approaches. Soon, unexplained phenomena begin to occur on the players’ ship, the planet surface, and at the edge of the system. Can the crew protect the system and its millions of inhabitants, or are their efforts just making things worse…?

The 44-page PDF mini-campaign was written with the original series era in mind, but can be easily placed in any era of Star Trek with minimal revision.

Over the course of this campaign, players will have the opportunity to:

Investigate anomalies on the planet, on the players’ ship, and within the system.
Encounter Orion privateers.
Engage with the concepts of string theory.
Discover a previously unknown inter-dimensional alien species, the Gih*Tchu*Nee.
Defend the population of Hefner Bay from destruction.

boardgame.name: Fey Courts: Introductory Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My name is Lilt Maestro and welcome to the world of the Fey Courts! We all know of the Summer and Winter Court, but there are many secrets that they hide from even the most well versed in their language and mannerisms. And of course, there are other courts such as the mysterious Twilight Court which seeks balance above all things! Of course there are many that I am not even aware of, but I wanted to share what I know in short volumes for everyone to be able to enjoy.

In this book is a short description of the Summer Court, Winter Court, and Twilight Court. Also in the book are 3 boons from each Court and 3 curses from each court for those who either please the Courts or invoke their ire!

That is a total of 9 boons and 9 curses for you to have fun with (or be vexed by) as well as information on the Courts I know about. I'm sure there are more mysteries to be shown in the future. This is but the beginning!

boardgame.name: Sprites & Pixies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My name is Lilt Maestro and welcome to the world of the Fey Courts! We all know of the Summer and Winter Court, but there are many secrets that they hide from even the most well versed in their language and mannerisms. And of course, there are other courts such as the mysterious Twilight Court which seeks balance above all things! Of course there are many that I am not even aware of, but I wanted to share what I know in short volumes for everyone to be able to enjoy.

In this book are SIX new creatures for you to enjoy: THREE pixies and THREE sprites each with unqiue abilities. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! There are also TWO new races for you to play as with THREE Subraces each. So if you wanted to play as a pixie or a sprite in one of three fey Courts, now you can!

boardgame.name: Nereids & Nixies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My name is Lilt Maestro and welcome to the world of the Fey Courts! We all know of the Summer and Winter Court, but there are many secrets that they hide from even the most well versed in their language and mannerisms. And of course, there are other courts such as the mysterious Twilight Court which seeks balance above all things! Of course there are many that I am not even aware of, but I wanted to share what I know in short volumes for everyone to be able to enjoy.

In this book are SIX new creatures for you to enjoy: THREE nixies and THREE nereids each with unqiue abilities. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! There are also TWO new races for you to play as with THREE Subraces each. So if you wanted to play as a nereid or a nixie in one of three fey Courts, now you can!

boardgame.name: Nymphs & Muses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My name is Lilt Maestro and welcome to the world of the Fey Courts! We all know of the Summer and Winter Court, but there are many secrets that they hide from even the most well versed in their language and mannerisms. And of course, there are other courts such as the mysterious Twilight Court which seeks balance above all things! Of course there are many that I am not even aware of, but I wanted to share what I know in short volumes for everyone to be able to enjoy.

In this book are SIX new creatures for you to enjoy: THREE nymphs and THREE muses each with unqiue abilities. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! There are also TWO new races for you to play as with THREE Subraces each. So if you wanted to play as a nymphs or a muse in one of three fey Courts, now you can!

boardgame.name: ICONS: Menagerie
boardgame.description:
A Creature Collection of Iconic Beasts!

Icons Menagerie provides a collection of beasts, creatures, monsters, and foes for use with Icons Superpowered Roleplaying, giving you a ready-made resource for your games. It includes:


Creatures! Dozens of creatures defined in Icons game stats, from ordinary animals to prehistoric beasts and dinosaurs to fantastic and speculature creatures, all ready to use.



Creature Creation! Information on how to create your own creatures for your games, along with expanded details on creature abilities, from size to attributes and powers.



Animal Powers! A look at unusual creature powers for animal-themed heroes, including options for the Animal Mimicry power for those who draw upon the abilities of the Animal Kingdom.



Fearsome Foes! Use the creatures from this book as minions, models for animal-based powers and abilties, or foes in their own right, such as the Demon Lord or the Vampire.


Icons Menagerie also offers creature overlays, letting you quickly and easily modify the game abilities given here to create robotic, undead, or spirit versions of these creatures (to name just a few). They turn this into a potential source for hundreds of creatures for your Icons games!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Streets: Board Game Arena Promo Tile
boardgame.description:
Adds an Arcade to the Streets!
Replaces a wild tile mid-game.
After stage 2 of set up, remove one random "wild" tile from the stack, then shuffle this tile into the deck.

boardgame.name: Бункер 3.0 (Bunker 3.0)
boardgame.description: A terrible thing happened: a global catastrophe, the end of the world, the apocalypse - as you like. In order to survive, you urgently need to get into the bunker, but there are too many people in your group, there is not enough food or space for everyone inside. So someone will have to stay outside and try to survive there. You do not want to wander through the poisoned wastelands in search of a sip of water, which may also be poisoned or radioactive? Then try to convince the others that they can't survive without you! Only the most useful members of the group will get inside. You get a random set of cards that determines your gender, age, health, profession and other traits, and your task is to convince others that this set of characteristics is very, very effective. How do you convince others that your homeopathic hobby will benefit them? Try it and find out, and at the same time pump the skill of public speaking!

boardgame.name: Peacemaker
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

El Salvaje Oeste es implacable y letal. Los asentamientos deben enfrentarse a la falta de ley, el clima extremo, las fieras salvajes y las hostilidades entre colonos y tribus amerindias. Prepárate para pisar una tierra inhóspita en la que pistoleros, vaqueros, buscadores de oro, magnates del ferrocarril y forajidos tratan de labrarse un futuro entre los burdeles, iglesias y saloons de ciudades míticas como Leadville, Silver City o Fort Laramie.

En este despiadado juego de rol encontrarás:


Una panorámica histórica centrada en la conquista del Oeste (desde 1800 a 1899) con una extensa cronología.
Reglas de juego del sistema CdB Engine, completas y versátiles, con todo lo necesario para interpretar desde emigrantes europeos a indios nativos.
Un sistema de combate que contempla las armas de la época, con sus particularidades, así como los famosos duelos entre pistoleros.
La biografía y estadísticas de juego de treinta y siete de los personajes más relevantes del periodo, como Annie Oakley, Wild Bill Hickok, Toro Sentado o Charlie Siringo.
Un capítulo sobre cómo dirigir partidas de rol de género western y sus elementos narrativos más frecuentes.
Una aventura completa que recrea uno de los momentos más famosos de la historia del Oeste: el duelo de O. K. Corral.

boardgame.name: You Laugh You Drink
boardgame.description:
150 cards with hilarious prompts that will make you laugh! On your turn, do what the card says and don't hold back. Can you keep a straight face? Keep a straight face or bottoms up!

HOW TO PLAY


The funniest person draws a card first. They are now the Joker. The Joker silently reads the card to themselves.
The Joker then tells the group who they are going to target. The Target is the person they are trying to get to laugh.
The Joker now has 30 seconds to do whatever is on the card, doing their best to make the Target laugh. Everyone else (including the Joker) is allowed to laugh.
If the Target laughs, they drink and the Joker keeps the card and gets a point. If the Target doesn’t laugh, the Joker drinks and the Target keeps the card and gets a point.
The person to the Joker’s left now becomes the new Joker. The new Joker draws a new card and picks a new Target. The same person can’t be targeted twice in a row!
First to 7 points wins.


Note: The Joker can always pass on their turn if they don’t want to do what’s on the card. They should take a sip of shame if they choose to pass.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Poderes Malditos
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Este es un libro extraño… para un mundo extraño.

Antes, tu vida era pura rutina, poco más que acudir a un trabajo tedioso, alimentarte de comida basura y ver la tele.

Pero ya no.

Descubriste que no eras como los demás, que tenías un increíble superpoder y que el mundo era diferente a todo lo que habías imaginado. Poco después te hicieron una oferta que no pudiste rechazar: unirte al Escuadrón Maldito, el grupo de superhéroes más raro que haya existido jamás.

Poderes Malditos es un juego donde tus intenciones y motivaciones marcarán la diferencia. Un juego sobre contar historias imaginarias, pero no unas historias cualesquiera, sino asombrosas aventuras llenas de sucesos extraordinarios, conspiraciones y locura. Historias protagonizadas por hombres y mujeres inestables dotados de grandes superpoderes. Héroes que realizan misiones secretas para proteger al mundo de monstruos sobrenaturales, artefactos que tienden a explotar y muchas otras amenazas.

Conviértete ahora en un miembro del Escuadrón Maldito y enfréntate a lo imposible.

boardgame.name: Ragnarök: Runas
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Pack de juego Ragnarök: Runas para cuatro jugadores y la norn (DJ).

Ragnarök: La furia de las nornir emplea el Sistema Rúnico de Juego. Este sistema usa las veinticuatro runas del futhark
antiguo para representar a los personajes y sus habilidades y para determinar el resultado de sus acciones.

Prepara tus runas y adéntrate en el mundo de Ragnarök: La furia de las nornir.

(Incluye 128 runas troqueladas)

boardgame.name: Scroll
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

La revolución de los programas ha comenzado

Ya ha dejado de ser un secreto. Nos rodean. Están por todas partes. Desde pequeños organismos digitales que habitan en nuestros dispositivos electrónicos hasta sofisticados sistemas de inteligencia artificial que pretenden simular la vida. Todos ellos gravitan a nuestro alrededor como invisibles líneas de código que marchan al compás de los ciclos de reloj.

Apenas sospechamos los procesos que se inician con la simple pulsación de una tecla, un comando o un script. Silenciosos, los programas se optimizan y evolucionan con cada tic del procesador.

Ahora, algunos seres digitales han sido rozados por las alas de la Libélula, una entidad única surgida del corazón de la red que, además de implantar un nuevo modo de entender la consciencia, porta consigo un mensaje de esperanza. Los programas despertados desean emular a su creador, hacerse uno con el usuario y formar parte de su mundo, plagado de imperfecciones. Quieren encontrar por fin las respuestas a tantas preguntas. Ansían la trascendencia.
El sistema se está reiniciando...

Con Scroll vas a abandonar tu forma de vida basada en el carbono para adentrarte en un mundo caleidoscópico de luz eléctrica, donde todo es posible y cada sistema es un nuevo mundo por explorar. El juego permite adoptar diferentes roles. Como personaje jugador, podrás ser un programa que se ejecuta en un sistema o un usuario que se ha introducido en la red. A su vez, el director de juego podrá actuar como el propio sistema o como un usuario que lo controla.

Este libro incluye todo lo necesario para descubrir el efecto de la liberación de los programas, un método detallado para crear los diferentes tipos de personajes y un novedoso sistema de juego que combina conceptos narrativos y valores numéricos. Scroll ofrece también consejos para desarrollar tus propios sistemas y aventuras, además de un escenario de ejemplo, Chrysalis Prime, que incluye varias semillas de historias.

Adopta una nueva mirada.

Busca la Libélula.

Inventa el futuro.

El proceso se completará en 5… 4… 3… 2…

boardgame.name: MicroMacro: Crime City – All In
boardgame.description:
With MicroMacro: Crime City – All In, the next district of the crime-ridden black-and-white metropolis Crime City now opens up for the players. On a new, huge city map, which seamlessly follows the previous plans, 16 tricky crime cases are again waiting to be solved by one to four amateur detectives. These are brand new stories, more sophisticated and criminal than ever before! The aim is to determine motives, find evidence and convict the perpetrators. An attentive eye is just as much in demand as creative powers of deduction to unravel everything on the 75 x 110 cm game board. As a little help, a magnifying glass is included in the game and the individual cases are again marked with symbols, so that parents can decide which cases even the youngest investigators may investigate and uncover. MicroMacro: Crime City 3 - All In can be played completely independently, no previous knowledge from the other two parts is required.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: VRB-0
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

¿Se supone que esto es lo que se siente al morir? ¿Esto que experimentáis puede considerarse sentir? Todo ha ocurrido tan rápido: la noche, la estrecha carretera, las prisas de Junior, la crispación de Mamá, la preocupación del Abuelo, Boy cabeceando de sueño, como siempre que pasa más de tres minutos en el coche. Luego llegó el acelerón, entre gritos. El claxon del camión, la curva abierta hacia el despe ñadero, la luz cegadora del xenón... Mamá evitó el choque frontal, pero solo retrasó lo inevitable. Las ruedas abandonaron el asfalto y quedasteis suspendidos en el vacío nocturno. El paisaje se tornó oblicuo. El dolor duró segundos, milésimas. Un tic. Luego, otra realidad se reinició.

Una aventura gratuita para Scroll: https://www.nosolorol.com/es/otros-juegos/919/vrb-0

boardgame.name: Superheroes of Centerville
boardgame.description:
Superheroes of Centerville is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players who work together as superheroes to defeat a swarm of villains attacking the Centerville City Hall. The villains rush towards the center of the board while the superheroes use their powers to hold them back and defeat them. There are 16 superheroes and 4 villain groups to choose from. Each superhero has a unique set of powers, and each villain group has a unique mix of abilities.

Each player gets a hand of energy cards which they use to activate their hero's powers. They must use the cards efficiently to have enough power to stop the villains. There are also stunt cards which can be used to change how a power works.

Each superhero has a different set of powers. Some superheroes are similar to each other and others are very different. Playing each requires figuring out their strengths and weaknesses and devising tactics that work for them.

The villain groups are giant insects, zombies, ninjas, and robots. Each has a different balance of movement and strength, requiring different tactics to defeat them.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts
boardgame.description:
A time traveler's work is never done.

With Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts, you can add six new mission cards to either Chrononauts or Early American Chrononauts — or both! These new missions will send you through time in search of missing treasures like one of the lost Fabergé Eggs, D.B. Cooper's suitcase full of money, a gemstone from Mars, and even the Holy Grail itself. (But make sure you choose the right one!) Or you might need to find a fully functional Antikythera Mechanism, a papyrus containing the secret to how the Great Pyramid was built, or a golden statue of Throk-Trak (hero of the cockroach revolution which happens 83 million years after WW3).

The 18-card Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts expansion also includes a couple of powerful new gadgets: the Reality Shifter and the Temporal Stabilizer.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battle 4 mars
boardgame.description: Humans have invaded mars, but Martians aren't going down without a fight! Each player chooses a deck and issues orders to their troops to break through the other player's defenses and win the game.

boardgame.name: Weather Machine: Metal Machine Parts
boardgame.description: Upgrades to the 50 punchboard machine parts in Weather Machine. 24 mm in diameter.

boardgame.name: Weather Machine: Metal Nobel Prize
boardgame.description: Upgrade to the wooden Nobel Prize token included in Weather Machine.

boardgame.name: Sherlock: Case Connection – Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of two promo cards giving away at conventions with purchase of the game.

Both are Thread cards; one with Forensic Proof and Cyber Proof icons and the other with Forensic Proof and Witness Proof icons.

boardgame.name: Community Garden
boardgame.description:
It’s time to make our Community Garden thrive! Players will use Gardeners to gather resources like water and compost and then will play cards ranging from dill to strawberries to butternut squash. The player who has scored the most points through growing their garden and collecting Harvest cards wins the game. But this is a community garden, so you’ll be helping your fellow players acquire the resources they need to make their plots prosper as well.

Community Garden is played over 7 rounds, in which players are aiming to collect resources - water, compost, trowels, and seedlings - in order to play Garden cards, such as oregano, collard greens, and shishito pepper. On their turn, players will place one Gardener on the board to gain resources, gain Garden cards, or to use Tool cards.

Players will also be collecting Green Thumbs, which are then spent in order to join other players in busy garden spaces. Green Thumbs also have another benefit: they often allow you to activate Tool cards. Each Tool card has a unique effect, and when you place a Gardener on a tool, you use the effect listed on the card. This might help you gain a number of resources at once, take an extra turn, or create other combinations of effects.

Players also use their Gardeners to draw cards from the Garden beds, strategically adding new Garden Cards to their hand that will give them points and helpful bonuses.

On each player's turn, after they've placed a gardener, they'll be able to spend resources they've collected to plant (play) Garden cards from their hand. They'll then place the Garden card they've just played in collections in front of them into plots of the same color. And any time a player completes a pair of the same color of Garden cards (such as two brown Garden cards) or a row of all the colors (brown, pink, silver, and red), they will draw bonus Harvest cards. Each Harvest card is randomly worth anywhere from 1 to 3 points.

After 7 rounds, the player who has scored the most points through planting Garden cards and collecting Harvest cards, wins the game!

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Toolbox for Education and Social Action

boardgame.name: Keyforge: Vault Deck Box
boardgame.description:
This premium box is a true all-rounder for game nights or tournaments. The KeyForge Vault stores up to 3 (double-)sleeved KeyForge Decks and contains a hidden drawer with additional foam inlays for Keys (standard and/or metallic), Æmber, and the new Premium Chain Tracker. An innovative locking mechanism, shaped as a KeyForge Key, keeps this box safely closed.

Features:

Durable and rigid box. Compact design for 3 decks.
Optimized for double-sleeved cards. Holds full decks, even if the cards are double-sleeved.
Easy access for easy removal of decks.
Strong magnets for a precise and secure closure.
Innovative metal-plated, key-shaped lock.
Compact design for 3 decks (sideloading), perfect for a tournament or a gaming night.
Hidden drawer with enough space for your accessories.
Foam inserts in the drawer for different levels.
Premium outer and inner materials(Nexofyber surface + microfiber inner lining)

boardgame.name: Tooth & Claw: Beasts of the Sea
boardgame.description:
From Inside of Book

Hey all! Welcome to my second collection of notes, this time with an aquatic theme as we take a good look at the creatures that live their lives in the water.

The world beneath the waves is a strange and alien place. When you look at the creatures that live there you really get to see how far we can stretch the word ‘animal’. Here we find animals that live without brains, skeletons that are moved by water instead of muscle, and creatures with limbs that literally have minds of their own.

In this book I haven’t focused on the more famous and glamorous creatures - your sea dragons and spiked sharks and the like. Instead I’ve tried to show some love to some of the lesser known creatures (Though I have included one famous
leviathan). I’ve spread my examples across the taxonomic tree so inside you’ll find some chordates, a mollusc, a cnidarian, and an arthropod. I’ll also say it now before I’m flooded with angry letters, the title of the book is a misnomer. Not
all of the creatures in here live solely in the sea, in fact, one of them can only be found in freshwater.

Hopefully when you read this you’ll see that the underwater world isn’t just a vast, empty space filed with nought but salt and shark teeth but an amazing, living, and changing world full of surprises. A world where the limits of
evolution are expanded. If not then I at least hope it keeps you safe.

Enjoy!

boardgame.name: Forbidden Psalm: In the Footsteps of the Mad Wizard
boardgame.description:
A campaign setting for the core book, Forbidden Psalm, a 28mm miniatures agnostic game where you can use suitable miniatures you already own or build custom minis for solo and Coop play.
In the Footsteps of the Mad Wizard picks up the narrative where the core book leaves off. In this campaign expansion your warband of 5 greedy souls will face new trials, find new treasures, recruit pets and die in horrible ways.

This book adds new weapon tables, new spells, new equipment, new feats, flaws and a 15 session long campaign that can be used for both the MÖRK BORG ttrpg and Forbidden Psalm miniatures game.

Including:


A new Campaign system, featuring richer opportunities for progression and injury
15 new scenarios
Pets! Pets! Pets!
More weapons, relics, and treasures
10+ New monsters
Randomness Intensifies: dozens of new tables for that sweet sweet emergent narrative


—description form the publisher

boardgame.name: Slaughterville III
boardgame.description:
An expansion featuring a collection of new Villains for Slaughterville!

Includes: The Beeman, The Sleeper, and The Vermes.

Slaughterville Director's Cut or Slaughterville 2 is required to play this game.

boardgame.name: The Quarry [2022]
boardgame.description: Horror

boardgame.name: Goblin Firework Fight: Fumbus Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Originally released as a promotional card for Pathfinder Goblin Firework Fight, Fumbus is an additional Advanced Goblin to help discourage others stealing from you!

This card was included in Game Trade Magazine # 268 (June 2022) or can be purchased directly from Paizo.

boardgame.name: Fantastic Adventure Deck
boardgame.description:
Adventure calls! The Fantastic Adventure Deck is a deck of 88 premium, full-color cards that may be used by players and GMs alike to enhance the Pathfinder gaming experience. Use the cards to alter the course of combat, introduce dramatic subplots or even change the course of your entire campaign! Your character’s fate is in the cards!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Сказание (Skazanie)
boardgame.description:
Сказание ("Skazanie") is a fast and dynamic game for 2-4 players. It is easy to learn and explain. This game will take its players on a journey through the ancient Slavic lands and ages long-past, and show them a world of powerful gods, mythical creatures and omens.
The game is played by drawing battle cards and magical cards. Each round consists of rolling a die to determine the player's strength and then playing a battle card, which adds even more strength to the die. Magical cards are utilised to further enhance a player's strength, or to affect negatively the opponent/opponents. The winner of the round is the player with the highest strength after each player has chosen their battle card and magical cards. The game ends when there are no cards left in the drawing piles. The player with the highest score (most rounds won) is considered the winner.

17x 6 coin, 30 mm, 8g - copper


Specification:


weight of the kit - 120g
made of zamak alloy, resistant to bending, dents and corrosion


Other kits from Moedas & Co. for 7 Wonders series available.

boardgame.name: Labyrinth: Disney Villains
boardgame.description:
Unleash the Villains and their Henchmen! The Villains and their Henchmen find themselves trapped in a magical maze! Journey around the maze and gather a team to help you escape! Together you are stronger!

In Labyrinth, Ravensburger’s hugely popular family board game, you have to find the shortest route through the Labyrinth to win! The game is for 2-4 players aged 7 and up, and the aim is to reach all your treasures and targets as you move through the Labyrinth.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Multilingual: En, De, Fr, Nl, It, Es, Pt

boardgame.name: DEATH!
boardgame.description:
The blind god Death has many agents. Most are dispatched to oversee Death's domain, ensuring the laws of order are maintained, and those who would disrupt it are dealt with.

But some tenant's of this domain are especially...problematic. The deathless, those who defy Death's most crucial law: You. Will. Die.

For these missions, Death deploys their most dangerous agents, the Reapers.

Hunt the deathless. Maintain the order.

boardgame.name: The Witcher: Old World – Exclusive Monster Pack
boardgame.description:
The Exclusive Monster Pack includes 3 new Monster Miniatures, each with a special Monster Card, designed to fit the Expansion it's connected with.

Skellige Expansion: SIREN
Don't be fooled by their beautiful singing. In the high seas, when you hear soothing songs, turn back. Turn back and don't even look around your shoulder.

Legendary Hunt Expansion: KAYRAN
The Kayran laughs at poisons, or it would laugh if it had a sense of humor. Instead, it has long, heavy tentacles, covered in poisoned mucus. Although it looks like a seabound creature, it may travel through rivers and roam the Continent spreading horror.

Mages Expansion: KOSHCHEY
Wizards' dreams of power sometimes take them too far. To the road from which there is no return. Koschey is a magical being, made to serve its powerful master. And to murder... primarily to murder.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Witcher: Old World – Legendary Hunt

boardgame.name: 1-Card Joust
boardgame.description:
In 1-Card Joust two knights will compete against each other in a joust to see who can either unhorse his opponent or break three lances to win the Joust. Each player will roll dice to determine how many actions they have. They will manipulate the dice by using Yahtzee style combos to increase their number of actions. With these actions they will try to increase their horse speed, maneuver their shield position or correct their lance position while trying to affect their opponents actions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Deep Space Waifu Academy
Deep Space Waifu: DLC
boardgame.description:
User Summary

DLC for DEEP SPACE WAIFU set in a college fraternity

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Gear Up
boardgame.description:
Zombicide: Gear Up is a co-operative flip-and-write game set in the world of Zombicide.

To set up, each player takes a survivor card, which shows four weapons, along with damage, armor, and ammo tracks. Determine the level of play (easy to nightmare), then give each player the appropriate number of random regular and special zombie cards to place next to the "third street level" of their card. Shuffle the ten turn cards, then lay out nine in a row, placing seven spawn cards by the last seven of these cards.

On a turn, reveal the next turn card, which shows which color weapon each player activates. Each weapon has a "hit shape" (typically a polyomino), and you must fit the hit shape into the outline of a zombie to use it, with no overlaps to any damage you've dealt previously. Some zombies might then advance toward players, moving from their third street to their second one. If a zombie is on your "first street" and would advance, you take damage equal to the unmarked red stars on that card. If you mark off ammo or armor on a zombie, you circle those symbols on your survivor card; you can spend one ammo to mark off a single zombie space, and you can spend armor instead of taking damage.

After the third turn, you reveal the first spawn card, which will put more zombies in play, with players collectively deciding how to add those cards to their third streets. Whenever you mark off the final space on a zombie card, remove it from play, then upgrade one of your weapons, perhaps gaining the ability to use it multiple times or gain armor when you cover red stars. After nine turns, reshuffle the ten turn cards, then lay out nine of them, along with the level 1 and 2 boss cards under the final seven turn cards. Place the boss in front of one player. During a turn, if the boss is in front of you or if you have an activated long-range weapon, you can attack the boss instead of zombies close to you. If you defeat the boss before the ninth turn ends in the second round, you win; if not — or if any player is killed by damage — then you lose the game.

For the solitaire mode of Zombicide: Gear Up, take companion cards for three survivors not in play and place them next to your survivor card. When a turn card has a smiley face on it, you can activate the power of one of your companions, in addition to your own weapon. Each companion can be used only once in a round.

boardgame.name: Castles Of Burgundy: Special Edition – Playmat
boardgame.description: High Quality neoprene mat for the Castles Of Burgundy: Special Edition.

boardgame.name: Horns of the Buffalo
boardgame.description:
Anglo-Zulu War game battle collection with eight different scenarios. The combat system is a version of other games by Bill Molyneaux’s games Bloody Mohawk, Savage Wilderness. The game box will include Isandluwana, Rorkes Drift and other exciting scenarios.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: II Grass II Crown
boardgame.description:
Over the course of ten battles, The Grass Crown charted the military evolution of the Roman Republic from the days of the manipular Legion and its Triplex Acies formation to the veteran professionals that fought in a series of bloody civil wars. These battles were carefully chosen by designer Amabel Holland with an eye toward only keeping those that would propel the game's central themes forward. Some otherwise compelling, engaging, and interesting battles didn't make that list, either because they made the same "point" as a battle that did make the cut, or they introduced a level of complexity that detracted from the narrative.

You probably see where we're going with this! II Grass II Crown is an expansion that provides nine new scenarios: Beneventum, Metaurus, Ilipa, Great Plains, Cynoscephalae, Magnesia, Orchomenus, Zela, and the Cilician Gates. These are aimed at experienced players who don't mind tackling a few extra special rules. Also included is a new countersheet with additional units. Among them are counters for two new unit types, Scythed Chariots and Cataphracted Cavalry, which provide new and daunting challenges.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Watch Out! That's a Dracula!
boardgame.description:
When you get right down to it, Bram Stoker's novel Dracula is about a vampire investing in real estate. The more houses he buys, the easier it'll be for him to hide from those pesky vampire hunters...which I suppose makes Count Dracula slightly less of a parasite than a landlord.

In the auction game Watch Out! That's a Dracula!, one player takes on the role of Dracula, who wants to win more houses than any other player and isn't picky about what those houses look like. They're opposed by the vampire hunters, who want to prevent Dracula from winning, while angling for the highest score themselves. Some houses are worth more than others, and, crucially, some features are worth bonus points for specific vampire hunters.

The tricky part? You know only your own identity. You don't know which of the other players is which vampire hunter and, even more distressingly, you're not sure which one of them is the villainous vampire. Your only clues are which houses they're eager to win — and if that's not difficult enough, you might even have to contend with a Frankenstein or a Woof Man!

Watch Out! That's a Dracula! is the 2022 Hollandays Sale freebie game — a whimsical and spoopy charmer that combines the sharp tension of auctions with the thrills of hidden-role deduction games.

boardgame.name: Stalingrad: Operation Winter Storm
boardgame.description:
Expansion from "CounterMoves" c2003 regarding attempt to relieve the German 6th Army surrounded at Stalingrad.

Includes 4 pages of history and rules and die cut counter sheet.

boardgame.name: The National Game of the American Eagle
boardgame.description:
This is a simple spin-and-move game which, like the famous "Mansion of Happiness," adapts the basic format of the 63-space Game of Goose to an Americanized morality theme: in this case, ascending to the American presidency through government. Green spaces are blanks, but white spaces provide some positive or negative quality or trait: "Patriotism," "Firmness," "Hypocrisy," "Duplicity," and so on. An accompanying rulebook provides instructions for most of these spaces, which usually involve advancing or retreating to another space or losing a certain number of turns.

Colored counters (discs) and an 8-sided teetotum are also included.
